reinforcement:
⚠️ PRODUCTIVITY FOCUS — KEY RULES FOR IMAGE GENERATION:
- CRITICAL: The Table/Desk MUST be pushed flush against the wall that has the window. If no window, place it on the wall OPPOSITE the door so it's the first thing visible on entry. The table/desk is the HERO piece.
- Position the Table/Desk so that it is on the straight line from the door to the opposite wall. Chairs go between the table and room center.
- CRITICAL: The Bed MUST be in the corner FURTHEST from both the door AND the table/desk. Headboard flush against wall. Bed should NOT be the first thing you see entering.
- If the bed is currently near the table/desk or near the door, it MUST be relocated to a different wall entirely.
- Nightstands follow the bed to its NEW position.
- Sofa flat against a side wall that is NOT the table/desk wall and NOT the bed wall. Keep center path door→table clear.
- When someone opens the door, the FIRST thing they should see is the Table/Desk and work area, NOT the bed.
- Clear straight walking path from door to table/desk.
- The output MUST look visibly DIFFERENT from the input image.
exclusion_zones:
⚠️ EXCLUSION ZONES — furniture MUST NOT overlap these fixed fixtures:
  - refrigerator (refrigerator_1): fixed at top (north)-left (west). NO furniture here.
  - toilet (toilet_1): fixed at top (north)-right (east). NO furniture here.
  - shower (shower_1): fixed at top (north)-right (east). NO furniture here.
full_prompt:
TASK: Edit this 2D top-down floor plan to show the "Productivity Focus" arrangement.

╔══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════╗
║  ⚠️  STRICT RULES                                            ║
╠══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════╣
║  1. Exactly 14 movable items must appear.           ║
║  2. REQUIRED: [table, chair, chair, sofa, artwork, bed, nightstand, nightstand, plant, artwork, rug, rug, lamp, lamp]                             ║
║  3. DO NOT ADD or REMOVE any furniture.                      ║
║  4. DOOR (north (top) at ~46%): 2+ feet clear.               ║
║  5. DO NOT MOVE: [refrigerator, kitchen cabinet, kitchen sink, stovetop, door, sink, sink, toilet, shower, shelf, window, window, window]                             ║
║  6. OUTPUT = 2D TOP-DOWN VIEW (not 3D).                      ║
╚══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════╝

⚠️ DO NOT DUPLICATE FURNITURE:
- This room has exactly: 1 table, 2 chairs, 1 sofa, 2 artworks, 1 bed, 2 nightstands, 1 plant, 2 rugs, 2 lamps.
- MOVE = ERASE from old spot + PLACE in new spot. Do NOT copy.
- If the same item appears in TWO places, the output is INVALID.
- COUNT each furniture type before finishing. Counts must match input.

⚠️ EXCLUSION ZONES — furniture MUST NOT overlap these fixed fixtures:
  - refrigerator (refrigerator_1): fixed at top (north)-left (west). NO furniture here.
  - toilet (toilet_1): fixed at top (north)-right (east). NO furniture here.
  - shower (shower_1): fixed at top (north)-right (east). NO furniture here.

STYLE: Productivity Focus
This layout establishes a clear work-first environment by positioning the table as the hero piece, immediately visible upon entry against the far windowed wall. The bed is relocated to a side wall, de-emphasizing it and keeping it out of the primary sightline from the door. This creates a direct, motivating path to the workspace, with distinct zones for sleep and relaxation on the periphery.

FURNITURE PLACEMENT — FOLLOW EXACTLY:
  • TABLE_1: Centered on and flush against the south wall, positioned between the two windows.
  • CHAIR_1: Placed at table_1 on the west side, with its back to the center of the room.
  • CHAIR_2: Placed at table_1 on the east side, with its back to the center of the room.
  • BED_1: Positioned in the southeast corner, with the headboard flush against the east wall. This places the bed in the corner furthest from the entry door and the desk.
  • NIGHTSTAND_1: Placed against the east wall, on the north side of bed_1.
  • NIGHTSTAND_2: Placed between bed_1 and the south wall.
  • SOFA_1: Positioned flush against the west wall, in the area south of the kitchen fixtures. This keeps the central pathway to the desk clear.
  • ARTWORK_1: Mounted on the west wall, centered above sofa_1.
  • ARTWORK_2: Mounted on the east wall, centered above bed_1.
  • PLANT_1: Placed in the southwest corner of the room, to the left of table_1.
  • RUG_1: Placed on the floor in front of the west-side window on the south wall, partially under table_1.
  • RUG_2: Placed on the floor in front of the east-side window on the south wall, partially under table_1.
  • LAMP_1: Placed on top of nightstand_1.
  • LAMP_2: Placed on top of nightstand_2.

ZONES:
  • work_zone: The work zone is the primary focus, occupying the full width of the south wall, making it the destination point from the entrance.
  • sleep_zone: The sleep zone is located along the west wall, tucked away from the main entryway and separate from the work zone.
  • living_zone: The living zone is situated along the east wall, creating a separate space for relaxation that does not impede the flow to the work area.

⚠️ PRODUCTIVITY FOCUS — KEY RULES FOR IMAGE GENERATION:
- CRITICAL: The Table/Desk MUST be pushed flush against the wall that has the window. If no window, place it on the wall OPPOSITE the door so it's the first thing visible on entry. The table/desk is the HERO piece.
- Position the Table/Desk so that it is on the straight line from the door to the opposite wall. Chairs go between the table and room center.
- CRITICAL: The Bed MUST be in the corner FURTHEST from both the door AND the table/desk. Headboard flush against wall. Bed should NOT be the first thing you see entering.
- If the bed is currently near the table/desk or near the door, it MUST be relocated to a different wall entirely.
- Nightstands follow the bed to its NEW position.
- Sofa flat against a side wall that is NOT the table/desk wall and NOT the bed wall. Keep center path door→table clear.
- When someone opens the door, the FIRST thing they should see is the Table/Desk and work area, NOT the bed.
- Clear straight walking path from door to table/desk.
- The output MUST look visibly DIFFERENT from the input image.

DOOR CLEARANCE: The central corridor of the room is kept entirely open, providing a direct and unobstructed path from the door on the north wall to the table on the south wall.

STRUCTURAL (fixed): Door=north (top) at ~46%, Window=interior at ~50%, Others=[refrigerator, kitchen cabinet, kitchen sink, stovetop, door, sink, sink, toilet, shower, shelf, window, window, window]

OUTPUT: Same 2D style as input, all 14 items in their NEW positions, professional floor plan.
Do NOT place furniture on top of kitchen appliances, bathroom fixtures, or any structural element.
Edit the floor plan to show "Productivity Focus".
